spatialNAcUtils 0.99.1

    Spatial plot of multiple genes combined by averaging Z scores

    spot_plot_z_score.Rd

    This function wraps around spot_plot, plotting a summary of expression across multiple genes in a single spatial plot. A Z-score of each gene's expression across all spots is taken (computed for each spot). To produce a single value for each spot, Z-scores are averaged across all genes. This value is plotted spatially with spot_plot.

    spot_plot_z_score(
  spe,
  genes,
  sample_id,
  assayname = "logcounts",
  minCount = 0,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    spe

    A SpatialExperiment with colData column exclude_overlapping, passed to spatialLIBD::vis_gene or spatialLIBD::vis_clus

    genes

    character() of length >= 2 of gene names to plot in combination, expected to be in rownames(spe)

    sample_id

    character(1) passed to sampleid in spatialLIBD::vis_gene or spatialLIBD::vis_clus. Assumed to be a donor, possibly consisting of several capture areas to plot at once

    assayname

    character(1) passed to spatialLIBD::vis_gene

    minCount

    numeric(1) passed to passed to spatialLIBD::vis_gene

    ...

    Parameters accepted by spot_plot, excluding is_discrete or var_name, which are handled internally

    Value

    A ggplot object containing a "spot plot" of the specified sample and genes

    See also

    Other Spot plots summarizing expression of multiple genes simultaneously: spot_plot_pca(), spot_plot_sparsity()

    Author

    Nicholas J. Eagles

    Examples

    
#   Grab an example SpatialExperiment and suppose all of its spots should be
#   plotted (for spatialNAc, 'exclude_overlapping' will only have genuinely
#   overlapping spots be TRUE)
spe <- if (!exists("spe")) {
    spatialLIBD::fetch_data(type = "spatialDLPFC_Visium_example_subset")
}
#> 2024-03-15 13:02:55.799407 loading file /github/home/.cache/R/BiocFileCache/16bc27150004_spatialDLPFC_spe_subset_example.rds%3Fdl%3D1
spe$exclude_overlapping <- FALSE

white_matter_genes <- c(
    "ENSG00000197971", "ENSG00000131095", "ENSG00000123560",
    "ENSG00000171885"
)
spot_plot_z_score(
    spe = spe,
    genes = white_matter_genes,
    sample_id = unique(spe)$sample_id[1],
    assayname = "logcounts"
)
